title: 107_s1129
content: PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. The Executive Schedule pay rates are adjusted annually based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100 and takes effect before any adjustments under subsection (a). The adjusted rate is considered the official rate for the positions involved. No adjustment continues after the comparability payment for General Schedule employees. The adjustment for Executive Schedule positions is based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment continues even after the comparability payment has ended or been replaced. Contract appeals board members' rates are also adjusted to no less than 97 percent and 94 percent of the rate under paragraph (1). Effective at the beginning of the first applicable pay period, the adjustments take effect. Effective at the beginning of the first pay period after an adjustment in General Schedule pay rates, contract appeals board members' pay rates will be adjusted by the President. Conforming amendments are made to ensure consistency in the adjustments. Amendments are made to certain provisions in title 5 of the United States Code, excluding executive schedule comparability adjustments and limiting certain payments. Amendments are made to provisions in title 5 of the United States Code, limiting certain payments and adjusting references to level IV of the executive schedule to level III. Amendments are made to provisions in title 5 of the United States Code, limiting certain payments and adjusting references to level IV of the executive schedule to level III. Provisions relating to certain offices and positions within the judicial branch are also addressed. Amendments are made to provisions in title 5 of the United States Code, limiting certain payments and adjusting references to level IV of the executive schedule to level III for specific positions within the judicial branch. Amendments are made to provisions in title 5 of the United States Code, adjusting references to level IV of the executive schedule to level III for specific positions within the judicial branch. Amendments are made to adjust references to level IV of the executive schedule to level III for specific positions within the judicial branch, including the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts. The amendments made by this Act will take effect for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date of this Act.
